00023 SerialRS232::SerialRS232(const char * dev, const baudrates & baudrate,
00024                 const parities & parity, const databits & databitsnum,
00025                 const stopbits & stopbitsnum, const int & termc,
00026                 const unsigned int & buflen, const int & timeout)
00027                 throw (SerialRS232Exception &)
00028 {
00029         if (index(dev, '\0') == NULL)
00030                 throw SerialRS232Exception("[SerialRS232::SerialRS232] Device name must be null terminated");
00031 
00032         if (strlen(dev) < 0 || strlen(dev) > 64)
00033                 throw SerialRS232Exception("[SerialRS232::SerialRS232] Device name incorrect length");
00034 
00035         if (strchr(dev, ' ') != NULL)
00036                 throw SerialRS232Exception("[SerialRS232::SerialRS232] Device name cannot contain blank spaces");
00037 
00038         if ((m_port = open(dev, O_RDWR | O_NDELAY) )<0)
00039                 throw SerialRS232Exception("[SerialRS232::SerialRS232] Error opening the device");
00040         
00041         fcntl(m_port, F_SETFL, fcntl(m_port, F_GETFL, 0) & ~O_NDELAY);
00042 
00043         struct termio term;
00044 
00045         if (ioctl(m_port, TCGETA, &term) == -1)
00046                 throw SerialRS232Exception("[SerialRS232::SerialRS232] Error when calling ioctl (GET)");
00047 
00048         term.c_iflag |= IGNBRK;
00049         term.c_iflag &= ~(BRKINT | IGNPAR | PARMRK | INPCK | ISTRIP | INLCR | IGNCR | ICRNL | IUCLC | IXON | IXANY | IXOFF);
00050 
00051         term.c_oflag &= ~OPOST;
00052 
00053         term.c_lflag &= ~(ICANON | ISIG | ECHO);
00054 
00055         term.c_cc[VMIN] = 1;
00056         term.c_cc[VTIME] = 1;
00057 
00058         switch (stopbitsnum) {
00059                 case stop1:
00060                         term.c_cflag &= ~CSTOPB;
00061                         break;
00062                 case stop2:
00063                         term.c_cflag |= CSTOPB;
00064                         break;
00065                 default:
00066                         throw SerialRS232Exception("[SerialRS232::SerialRS232] Error setting stop bits number");
00067         }
00068 
00069         term.c_cflag &= ~CSIZE;
00070         switch (databitsnum) {
00071                 case data5:
00072                         term.c_cflag |= CS5;
00073                         break;
00074                 case data6:
00075                         term.c_cflag |= CS6;
00076                         break;
00077                 case data7:
00078                         term.c_cflag |= CS7;
00079                         break;
00080                 case data8:
00081                         term.c_cflag |= CS8;
00082                         break;
00083                 default:
00084                         throw SerialRS232Exception("[SerialRS232::SerialRS232] Error setting data bits number");
00085         };
00086 
00087         switch (parity) {
00088                 case noparity:
00089                         term.c_cflag &= ~PARENB;
00090                         break;
00091                 case odd:
00092                         term.c_cflag |= PARENB;
00093                         term.c_cflag |= PARODD;
00094                         break;
00095                 case even:
00096                         term.c_cflag |= PARENB;
00097                         term.c_cflag &= ~PARODD;
00098                         break;
00099                 default:
00100                         throw SerialRS232Exception("[SerialRS232::SerialRS232] Error setting parity");
00101         }
00102 
00103         term.c_cflag &= ~CBAUD;
00104 
00105         switch (baudrate){
00106                 case b50:
00107                         term.c_cflag |= B50;
00108                         break;
00109                 case b75:
00110                         term.c_cflag |= B75;
00111                         break;
00112                 case b110:
00113                         term.c_cflag |= B110;
00114                         break;
00115                 case b134:
00116                         term.c_cflag |= B134;
00117                         break;
00118                 case b150:
00119                         term.c_cflag |= B150;
00120                         break;
00121                 case b200:
00122                         term.c_cflag |= B200;
00123                         break;
00124                 case b300:
00125                         term.c_cflag |= B300;
00126                         break;
00127                 case b600:
00128                         term.c_cflag |= B600;
00129                         break;
00130                 case b1200:
00131                         term.c_cflag |= B1200;
00132                         break;
00133                 case b2400:
00134                         term.c_cflag |= B2400;
00135                         break;
00136                 case b4800:
00137                         term.c_cflag |= B4800;
00138                         break;
00139                 case b9600:
00140                         term.c_cflag |= B9600;
00141                         break;
00142                 case b19200:
00143                         term.c_cflag |= B19200;
00144                         break;
00145                 case b38400:
00146                         term.c_cflag |= B38400;
00147                         break;
00148                 case b57600:
00149                         term.c_cflag |= B57600;
00150                         break;
00151                 case b115200:
00152                         term.c_cflag |= B115200;
00153                         break;
00154                 default:
00155                         throw SerialRS232Exception("[SerialRS232::SerialRS232] Incorrect baud rate");
00156         };
00157 
00158         if (ioctl (m_port, TCSETA, &term)==-1)
00159                 throw SerialRS232Exception("[SerialRS232::SerialRS232] Error when calling ioctl (SET)");
00160 
00161 
00162         if (buflen <= 0)
00163                 throw SerialRS232Exception("[SerialRS232::SerialRS232] Buffer length must be greater than zero");
00164 
00165         m_dev = new char[strlen(dev) + 1];
00166         strcpy(m_dev, dev);
00167         
00168         m_baudrate = baudrate;
00169         
00170         m_parity = parity;
00171         
00172         m_databitsnum = databitsnum;
00173         
00174         m_stopbitsnum = stopbitsnum;
00175         
00176         m_termc = termc;
00177 
00178         m_buflen = buflen;
00179         m_buf = new char[m_buflen];
00180 
00181         m_timeout = timeout;
00182 }
00183 
00184 SerialRS232::~SerialRS232() throw (SerialRS232Exception &)
00185 {
00186         delete [] m_buf;
00187         delete [] m_dev;
00188         if (close(m_port) != 0)
00189                 throw SerialRS232Exception("[SerialRS232::~SerialRS232] Error closing");
00190 }

00192 char * SerialRS232::read_RS232() throw (SerialRS232Exception &)
00193 {
00194         struct tms process_time;
00195         long read_time;
00196         char read_char = -111; // absurd value, might be STX (decimal 2)
00197         int read_bytes = 0;
00198         int i = 0;
00199 
00200         if (m_timeout > 0)
00201                 read_time = times(&process_time) + m_timeout + 1;
00202         else
00203                 read_time = -1;
00204 
00205         struct termio term;
00206 
00207         if (ioctl(m_port, TCGETA, &term) == -1)
00208                 throw SerialRS232Exception("[SerialRS232::read_RS232] Error when calling ioctl (GET)");
00209 
00210         term.c_cc[VMIN] = 0;
00211         term.c_cc[VTIME] = (m_timeout + 9)/10;
00212 
00213         if (ioctl (m_port, TCSETA, &term) == -1)
00214                 throw SerialRS232Exception("[SerialRS232::read_RS232] Error when calling ioctl (SET)");
00215 
00216         while(((unsigned int)i < (m_buflen - 1)) && ((m_termc < 0) || (m_termc != read_char)))
00217         {
00218                 read_bytes = read(m_port, &read_char, 1);
00219                 if (read_bytes == -1)
00220                         throw SerialRS232Exception("[SerialRS232::read_RS232] Error reading");
00221                 if ((read_time > 0) && (read_time - times(&process_time)) <= 0)
00222                         throw SerialRS232Exception("[SerialRS232::read_RS232] Timeout reading");
00223                 if (read_bytes == 1)
00224                 {
00225                         *(m_buf + i) = read_char;
00226                         i++;
00227                 }
00228         }
00229 
00230         m_buf[i] = '\0';
00231         return m_buf;
00232 }
00233 
00234 void SerialRS232::write_RS232(const char * s) throw (SerialRS232Exception &)
00235 {
00236         if (index(s, '\0') == NULL)
00237                 throw SerialRS232Exception("[SerialRS232::write_RS232] String to be written must be null terminated");
00238         if (strlen(s) > (m_buflen - 1))
00239                 throw SerialRS232Exception("[SerialRS232::write_RS232] Too large string");
00240 
00241         strcpy(m_buf, s);
00242 
00243         m_buf[strlen(s)] = '\r';
00244         m_buf[strlen(s) + 1] = '\n';
00245 
00246         if (write(m_port, m_buf, strlen(s) + 1) != (int)(strlen(s) + 1))
00247                 throw SerialRS232Exception("[SerialRS232::write_RS232] Error writing");
00248 }
00249 
00250 void SerialRS232::flush_RS232() throw (SerialRS232Exception &)
00251 {
00252         if (ioctl(m_port, TCFLSH, 0) == -1)
00253                 throw SerialRS232Exception("[SerialRS232::flush_RS232] Error flushing");
00254 }
00255 
00256 SerialRS232::SerialRS232Exception::SerialRS232Exception(const char * ex) : exception()
00257 {
00258         strncpy(exception_msg, ex, 99);
00259 }
